# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the Julia code for the problem:

```julia
function wrap_string(str, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(str)
    line = ""
    function add_line()
        if !isempty(line)
            println(line)
            empty!(line)
        end
    end
    for word in words
        if length(word) + length(line) > text_width
            add_line()
        elseif isempty(line)
            line *= word
        else
            line *= " $(word)"
        end
    end
    add_line()  # for the last line without a newline character
end
```
You can use this function as follows:

```julia
str = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Sed do eiusmod tempor incididunt ut labore et dolore magna aliqua."
wrap_string(str)
```
